sub_title: Experienced large scale asset management leader and global transformation accelerator for C+P organization and work process execution of the future
summary:
Energetic, authentic, resilient and self-propelled transformational leader with a strong background in asset management and production operations. Close to 15 years of experience in Refinery Leadership Team roles and over 5 years experience in driving global large scale transformation. 

Considers HSSE and Ethics core values and takes pride in excellent performance, sustainably improving capabilities to drive current & future business outcomes and in coaching and inspiring staff to achieve beyond own expectations. Anticipates customer and stakeholder needs and leverages strategic imperatives and parallel initiatives to create opportunities to accelerate own and wider transformation agenda at minimum effort. Servant leader, seeking to deliver through others. 

Team player who establishes strong working relations across organizational layers, with internal stakeholders and external parties, and is comfortable working across different cultures both face to face and virtual.

location.default: Berkel en Rodenrijs, South Holland, Netherlands

profile_positions.description: Transformation Accelerator for Organizational Design and Work Process Execution for Shell Chemicals and Products. Responsible for migration of asset roles and business roles to Shell Business Operations locations and accountable to use the centralization of activities to aggregate, optimize, standardize and automate work process execution and provide transformational and future capabilities together with other Shell Lines of Business whilst creating strong natural teams between SBO and C+P assets and C+P market organizations.
profile_positions.title: Global Lead shell Business Operations for Chemicals and Products

profile_positions.description:
Continued to lead the Manufacturing Europe and East Ultimate Potential Journey delivering the stretch 2021 regional cash improvement target by August. 
Combined the Transformation Lead role with the role of Business Opportunity Manager for the migration of Manufacturing Asset roles and work activities to Technical Asset Operations, in August 2020. Accountable to expand the depth and penetration of migration activities, accelerate the pace of migration and create value beyond costs arbitrage. Member of the TAO leadership team to support the organizational, capability and cultural development of the fast growing TAO organization, to ensure sustainable new ways of working between TAO and assets across Shell. Increased the number of TAO staff supporting Manufacturing from the post pilot 120 FTE by August 2020 to 375 FTE by the end of 2021. Extended the view on Ultimate Potential of migration for Manufacturing and the role of TAO as an essential lever in work process execution improvement delivery and as an integral part of Manufacturing Asset of the Future. Reported value beyond cost arbitrage exceeds the cost arbitrage realized today and TAO is now involved in various global transformational opportunities.
Represented Manufacturing in Re-shape, Shell Business Organization work stream.
profile_positions.title: Business Manager Expansion Technical Asset Organisation and Transformation Manager

profile_positions.description:
Co-created the global transformation methodology to significantly accelerate the improvement capability and deliver a stretch recurring cost improvement target of over 15% of operating expenses by 2020 for the Manufacturing refineries and Chemical Complexes. Lead the implementation for Manufacturing Europe and East and facilitate the delivery of the regional asset targets.
Provided thought leadership and implemented the expansion of the methodology to include cash preservation (COVID response), margin, energy, working capital and digitalization to increase the total cash delivery to over 2 billion $ by end of 2020 and beating the original cost target.
The success of the Manufacturing approach inspired the Chemicals Business to follow first and other Downstream Lines Of Business thereafter. Significantly influenced the Chemicals IPM approach to remain close to the Manufacturing Transformation principles and led the start-up of IPM cadences for Shell Chemicals Europe. Actively supported and co-created the development of the overarching Downstream Ultimate Potential Journey approach thereafter.
Member of Ultimate Potential re-design team to integrate the Manufacturing and Chemicals transformation approaches and adapt to the new Chemicals and Products organization.
profile_positions.title: Transformation Manager Cost Competitiveness Manufacturing Europe and Asia

profile_positions.description: Accountable for safe and reliable operations at the Godorf site of Rheinland refinery and as member of the Refinery Leadership Team, for helping improve the competitive position and reputation of Rheinland Refinery. Lead the Godorf site through significant operational challenges from aging infrastructure and regulatory pressure. Key metrics: 250 direct FTE, 1250 indirect FTE, throughput 190 kb/d, yearly operational budget of about 150 Ml€ and capital budget of 150 Mln € (project and turnarounds combined). Prepared Godorf site for the future through implementation of leaner organizational structure, enhancing operational competencies and discipline, improving working relationships and driving critical process safety and asset integrity improvement programs integrated with the co-created longer term TA and Growth Projects strategy. Site Process Owner for various processes and member of the Shell Global Council for Permit to Work and Process Isolation while leading the global pathfinder development of electronic work permitting.
profile_positions.title: Production Manager Godorf site Rheinland Refinery

profile_positions.description: Lead the Turnaround Planning and Execution improvement for the Shell Europe and Africa refinery and chemical complexes with the objective to reach Top Quartile Performance in Safety, Duration, Quality and Costs. Also supported the Qatar Pearl GTL asset prepare for their first ever TA. Significantly enhanced thinking on longer term strategies, early project and construction integration, decontamination, required capabilities and discipline and contractor involvement. Used assurance reviews to drive the change process and the outcome of individual TA, but also to build a regional community of TA professionals. Co-created a multi year regional (Germany/Netherlands) TA planning and Execution contract with several contractors to leverage scale advantages and further embed improvements. Organized Shell wide support for Qatar Pearl GTL first TA to establish their TA execution backbone.
profile_positions.title: TA Director Europe Africa and Middle East

profile_positions.description: Accountable for the margin performance of the Montreal East Refinery and for leading the asset Business Improvement Plan. Member of the Shell Canada Enterprise First Team to co-create and support the Shell Products Business Development in Canada. Combined the above duties with Production Manager duties post announcement that the refinery would be transformed into an import terminal. Accountable for achieving uninterrupted supply of products while permanently shutting down the refinery at minimum costs and for early freeing up of tanks, maximum value preservation and recuperation of residual hydrocarbons and flushing fluids thereafter.
profile_positions.title: Economics and Scheduling Manager Montreal East Refinery

profile_positions.description: Production Unit Manger and member of the Refinery Leadership Team. Improved performance metrics and maintained high operational standards throughout various reorganizations, a very significant retirement wave, tightening product specs solved by minimum spending and throughout the sales process to Petroplus.
profile_positions.title: Production Unit Manager
